result.execSummary:
The defendant Teena M. Piotrowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teena M. Piotrowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Teena M. Piotrowski in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:05 p.m. Agreement stated - Def will plead to ct 1, Ct 2 dismiss and read in. 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, court costs. Atty Bayne-Allison and Def agree. Def admits prior conviction. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Ct 2 dismissed and read in consistent with agreement. Court review plea quest. and constitutional rights. Atty Bayne-Allison satisfied/factual basis. Court finds Def understands, accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 possess THC 2nd. Nothing by Defendant. Court accepts agreement. Sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, costs, apply bond.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Teena M. Piotrowski in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:35 p.m. Waiver of prelim filed. Court reviews with Def. Court satisfied waiver freely made, binds over. Information filed. Reading waived, not guilty pleas. Court accepts pleas.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Teena M. Piotrowski in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint received, reviewed, waive reading.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Bond conditions reviewed.  Def nows qualifies for public defender.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Teena M. Piotrowski in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has applied for court appointed atty.  Court has approved.  Statement by def in regards to retainer fee and monthly payment.  Court reviews court appointed attorney form.  Court will reduce the retainer fee to $200.00 and monthly payment will be $100.00.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Petition for Appointment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order - copy

Defendant Teena M. Piotrowski in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bond has been set and posted.  Court questions def if she contacted an atty.  Statement by def.  Court appointed atty explained.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
